verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never eat leavened bread with the meat from this sacrifice. Instead, for seven days you must eat unleavened bread at this festival. (It is the bread of misery because you left Egypt in a hurry.) Eat this bread so that, as long as you live, you will remember the day you left Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There should be no yeast anywhere in your land for seven days. Never leave until morning any of the meat you slaughter on the evening of the first day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You’re not allowed to slaughter the animals for Passover in any of the cities the Lord your God is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, slaughter your animals for Passover in the place where the Lord your God will choose for his name to live. Do this in the evening as the sun goes down. This is the same time you did it when you left Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cook the meat, and eat it at the place the Lord your God will choose. In the morning you may go back to your tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For six days eat unleavened bread, and on the seventh day hold a religious assembly dedicated to the Lord your God. Don’t do any work that day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Count seven weeks from the time you start harvesting grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then celebrate the Festival of Weeks to the Lord your God. Bring a freewill offering in proportion to the blessings the Lord your God has given you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Enjoy yourselves in the presence of the Lord your God along with your sons, daughters, male and female slaves, the Levites who live in your cities, the foreigners, orphans, and widows who live among you. Enjoy yourselves at the place the Lord your God will choose for his name to live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember that you were slaves in Egypt, and obey these laws carefully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After you have gathered the grain from your threshing floor  and made your wine, celebrate the Festival of Booths for seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Enjoy yourselves at the festival along with your sons, daughters, male and female slaves, the Levites, foreigners, orphans, and widows who live in your cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For seven days you will celebrate this festival dedicated to the Lord your God in the place he will choose. You will enjoy yourselves, because the Lord your God will bless all your harvest and all your work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three times a year all your men must come into the presence of the Lord your God at the place he will choose: at the Festival of Unleavened Bread, the Festival of Weeks, and the Festival of Booths. But no one may come into the presence of the Lord without an offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each man must bring a gift in proportion to the blessings the Lord your God has given him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Appoint judges and officers for your tribes in every city that the Lord your God is giving you. They are to judge the people fairly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never pervert justice. Instead, be impartial. Never take a bribe, because bribes blind wise people and deny justice to those who are in the right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Strive for nothing but justice so that you will live and take possession of the land that the Lord your God is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you build the altar for the Lord your God, never plant beside it any tree dedicated to the goddess Asherah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never set up a sacred stone. These are things the Lord your God hates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never offer an ox or a sheep that has a defect or anything seriously wrong with it as a sacrifice to the Lord your God. That would be disgusting to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In one of the cities the Lord your God is giving you, there may be a man or woman among you who is doing what the Lord considers evil. This person may be disregarding the conditions of the Lord’s promise
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by worshiping and bowing down to other gods, the sun, the moon, or the whole army of heaven. I have forbidden this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you are told about it, investigate it thoroughly. If it’s true and it can be proven that this disgusting thing has been done in Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then bring the man or woman who did this evil thing to the gates of your city, and stone that person to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The person can only be sentenced to death on the testimony of two or three witnesses, but no one should ever be sentenced to death on the testimony of only one witness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The witnesses must start the execution, then all the other people will join them in putting the person to death. You must get rid of this evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There may be a case that is too hard for you to decide. It may involve murder, assault, or a dispute—any case which may be brought to court in your cities. Take this case to the place that the Lord your God will choose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go to the Levitical priests and the judge who is serving at that time. Ask for their opinion, and they will give you their verdict
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: at the place that the Lord will choose. Do what they tell you. Follow all their instructions carefully,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and do what they tell you to do in their verdict. Do exactly what they tell you to do in their decision.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone deliberately disobeys the priest (who serves the Lord your God) or the judge, that person must die. You must get rid of this evil in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all the people hear about it, they will be afraid and will never defy God’s law again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will enter the land that the Lord your God is giving you. You will take possession of it and live there. You will say, “Let’s have our own king like all the other nations around us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be sure to appoint the king the Lord your God will choose. He must be one of your own people. Never let a foreigner be king, because he’s not one of your own people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king must never own a large number of horses or make the people return to Egypt to get more horses. The Lord has told you, “You will never go back there again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king must never have a large number of wives, or he will turn away from God. And he must never own a lot of gold and silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he becomes king, he should have the Levitical priests make him a copy of these teachings on a scroll.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He must keep it with him and read it his entire life. He will learn to fear the Lord his God and faithfully obey everything found in these teachings and laws.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he won’t think he’s better than the rest of his people, and he won’t disobey these commands in any way. So he and his sons will rule for a long time in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Levitical priests—in fact, the whole tribe of Levi—will receive no land or property of their own like the rest of the Israelites. They will eat what has been sacrificed to the Lord. These sacrifices will be what they receive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Levites will have no land of their own like the other Israelites. The Lord will be their inheritance, as he promised them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the people owe the priests whenever they sacrifice an ox, a sheep, or a goat: the shoulder, jaws, and stomach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also, give them the first produce harvested: grain, new wine, olive oil, and the first wool you shear from your sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Out of all your tribes, the Lord your God has chosen the Levites and their descendants to do the work of serving in the name of the Lord forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A Levite from any of your cities in Israel may come from where he has been living to the place the Lord will choose. He may come as often as he wants
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and may serve in the name of the Lord his God like all the other Levites who do their work in the Lord’s presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he does, he’ll get the same amount of food as they do, in addition to what he gets from selling his family’s goods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you come to the land that the Lord your God is giving you, never learn the disgusting practices of those nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must never sacrifice your sons or daughters by burning them alive, practice black magic, be a fortuneteller, witch, or sorcerer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: cast spells, ask ghosts or spirits for help, or consult the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever does these things is disgusting to the Lord. The Lord your God is forcing these nations out of your way because of their disgusting practices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must have integrity in dealing with the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These nations you are forcing out listen to fortunetellers and to those who practice black magic. But the Lord your God won’t let you do anything like that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God will send you a prophet, an Israelite like me. You must listen to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what you asked the Lord your God to give you on the day of the assembly at Mount Horeb. You said, “We never want to hear the voice of the Lord our God or see this raging fire again. If we do, we’ll die!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told me, “What they’ve said is good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I will send them a prophet, an Israelite like you. I will put my words in his mouth. He will tell them everything I command him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever refuses to listen to the words that prophet speaks in my name will answer to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But any prophet who dares to say something in my name that I didn’t command him to say or who speaks in the name of other gods must die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may be wondering, “How can we recognize that the Lord didn’t speak this message?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a prophet speaks in the Lord’s name and what he says doesn’t happen or come true, then it didn’t come from the Lord. That prophet has spoken on his own authority. Never be afraid of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God will destroy all the nations that are living in the land that he’s giving you. You will force them out and live in their cities and houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all this is done, set aside three cities in the land that the Lord your God is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Provide a route to each of these cities and divide the land that the Lord your God is giving you into three regions. Whoever kills someone may run to one of these cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A person who unintentionally kills someone he never hated in the past may run to one of these cities to save his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suppose two people go into the woods to cut wood. As one of them swings the ax to cut down a tree, the head flies off the handle, hits, and kills the other person. The one who accidentally killed the other person may run to one of these cities and save his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Otherwise, in a rage the relative who has the authority to avenge the death will pursue him. If the place is too far away, the relative may catch up with him and take his life even though he didn’t deserve the death penalty, because in the past he never hated the person he killed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is why I’m commanding you to set aside three cities for yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God may expand your country’s borders as he promised your ancestors with an oath. He may give you the whole land he promised to give them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He may do this because you faithfully obey all these commands I am now giving you—to love the Lord your God and follow his directions as long as you live. If this happens, you may add three more cities of refuge to these three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That way, innocent people won’t be killed in the land that the Lord your God is giving you, and you won’t be guilty of murder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suppose someone hates another person, waits in ambush for him, attacks him, takes his life, and runs to one of these cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If someone does this, the leaders of your city must send for that person. They must take him from that city and hand him over to the relative who has the authority to avenge the death. He must die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They must have no pity on him. The guilt of murdering an innocent person must be removed from Israel. Then things will go well for Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never move your neighbor’s original boundary marker on any property in the land that the Lord your God is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One witness is never enough to convict someone of a crime, offense, or sin he may have committed. Cases must be settled based on the testimony of two or three witnesses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what you must do whenever a witness takes the stand to accuse a person falsely of a crime.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The two people involved must stand in the Lord’s presence, in front of the priests and judges who are serving at that time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The judges must make a thorough investigation. If it is found that the witness lied when he testified against the other Israelite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then do to him what he planned to do to the other person. You must get rid of this evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the rest of the people hear about this, they will be afraid. Never again will such an evil thing be done among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have no pity on him: Take a life for a life, an eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth, a hand for a hand, and a foot for a foot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you go to war against your enemies, you may see horses, chariots, and armies larger than yours. Don’t be afraid of them, because the Lord your God, who brought you out of Egypt, will be with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Before the battle starts, a priest must come and speak to the troops.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He should tell them, “Listen, Israel, today you’re going into battle against your enemies. Don’t lose your courage! Don’t be afraid or alarmed or tremble because of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God is going with you. He will fight for you against your enemies and give you victory.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The officers should tell the troops, “If you have built a new house but not dedicated it, you may go home. Otherwise, you might die in battle, and someone else will dedicate it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you have planted a vineyard and not enjoyed the grapes, you may go home. Otherwise, you might die in battle, and someone else will enjoy the grapes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you are engaged to a woman but have not married her, you may go home. Otherwise, you might die in battle, and someone else will marry her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The officers should also tell the troops, “If you are afraid or have lost your courage, you may go home. Then you won’t ruin the morale of the other Israelites.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the officers finish speaking to the troops, they should appoint commanders to lead them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you approach a city to attack it, offer its people a peaceful way to surrender.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If they accept it and open their gates to you, then all the people there will be made to do forced labor and serve you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If they won’t accept your offer of peace but declare war on you, set up a blockade around the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Lord your God hands the city over to you, kill every man in that city with your swords.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But take the women and children, the cattle and everything else in the city, including all its goods, as your loot. You may enjoy your enemies’ goods that the Lord your God has given you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what you must do to all the cities that are far away which don’t belong to the nations nearby.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, you must not spare anyone’s life in the cities of these nations that the Lord your God is giving you as your property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must claim the Hittites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites for the Lord and completely destroy them, as the Lord your God has commanded you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Otherwise, they will teach you to do all the disgusting things they do for their gods, and you will sin against the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what you must do whenever you blockade a city for a long time in order to capture it in war. Don’t harm any of its fruit trees with an ax. You can eat the fruit. Never cut those trees down, because the trees of the field are not people you have come to blockade.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may destroy trees that you know are not fruit trees. You may cut them down and use them in your blockade until you capture the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what you must do if you find a murder victim lying in a field in the land that the Lord your God is giving you. If no one knows who committed the murder,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: your leaders and judges must go and measure the distance from the body to each of the neighboring cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it has been determined which city is nearest the body, the leaders from that city must choose a heifer that has never been put to work and never worn a yoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The leaders of that city will bring the heifer down to a river, to a location where the land hasn’t been plowed or planted. At the river they must break the heifer’s neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priests, the descendants of Levi, must come forward. The Lord your God has chosen them to serve him as priests and to bless people in the Lord’s name. Their decision is final in all cases involving a disagreement or an assault.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the leaders from the city which was nearest the murder victim must wash their hands over the dead heifer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they must make this formal statement: “We didn’t commit this murder, and we didn’t witness it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lord, make peace with your people Israel, whom you freed. Don’t let the guilt of this unsolved murder remain among your people Israel.” Then there will be peace with the Lord despite the murder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is how you will get rid of the guilt of an unsolved murder by doing what the Lord considers right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you go to war with your enemies and the Lord your God hands them over to you, you may take them captive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you see a beautiful woman among the captives and have your heart set on her, you may marry her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bring her into your home. She must shave her head, cut her nails,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and no longer wear the clothes she was wearing when you captured her. Then she may live in your house and mourn the loss of her father and mother for one month. After that, you may sleep with her. Then you will become husband and wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if it happens that you are no longer pleased with her, let her go wherever she wants. You must never sell her or mistreat her as if she were a slave, since you’ve already had sex with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man might have two wives and love one but not the other. Both wives might have children, and the firstborn son might belong to the wife that the man doesn’t love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the day comes for the father to give his sons their inheritance, he can’t treat the son of the wife he loves as if that son were the firstborn. This would show a total disregard for the real firstborn (the son of the wife he doesn’t love).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, he must recognize the son of the wife he doesn’t love as the firstborn. He must give that son a double portion of whatever he owns. That son is the very first son he had. The rights of the firstborn son are his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Parents might have a stubborn and rebellious son who doesn’t obey them. Even though they punish him, he still won’t listen to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His father and mother must take him to the leaders of the city at the city gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will say to the leaders of the city, “This son of ours is stubborn and rebellious. He won’t obey us. He eats too much and is a drunk.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the men of the city should stone him to death. You must get rid of this evil. When all Israel hears about it, they will be afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a convicted person is put to death,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: never leave his dead body hung on a pole overnight. Be sure to bury him that same day, because anyone whose body is hung on a pole is cursed by God. The land that the Lord your God is giving you must never become unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you see another Israelite’s ox or sheep out where it doesn’t belong, don’t pretend that you don’t see it. Make sure you take it back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the owner doesn’t live near you or you don’t know who owns it, take the animal home with you. Keep it until the owner comes looking for it. Then give it back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do the same if you find a donkey, some clothes, or anything else that another Israelite may have lost. Don’t pretend that you don’t know what to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you see another Israelite’s donkey or ox lying on the road, don’t pretend that you don’t see it. Make sure you help him get it back on its feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A woman must never wear anything men would wear, and a man must never wear women’s clothes. Whoever does this is disgusting to the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever you’re traveling and find a nest containing chicks or eggs, this is what you must do. If the mother bird is sitting on the nest, never take her with the chicks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may take the chicks, but make sure you let the mother go. Then things will go well for you, and you will live for a long time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever you build a new house, put a railing around the edge of the roof. Then you won’t be responsible for a death at your home if someone falls off the roof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never plant anything between the rows in your vineyard. Otherwise, you will have to give everything that grows there to the holy place. This includes the crop you planted and the grapes from the vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never plow with an ox and a donkey harnessed together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never wear clothes made of wool and linen woven together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make tassels on the four corners of the shawl you wear over your clothes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man might marry a woman, sleep with her, and decide he doesn’t like her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he might make up charges against her and ruin her reputation by saying, “I married this woman. But when I slept with her, I found out she wasn’t a virgin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The girl’s father and mother must go to the city gate where the leaders of the city are and submit the evidence that their daughter was a virgin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The girl’s father will tell the leaders, “I gave my daughter in marriage to this man, but he doesn’t like her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he has made up charges against her. He says he found out that my daughter wasn’t a virgin. But here’s the evidence!” Then the girl’s parents must spread out the cloth in front of the leaders of the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The leaders of that city must take the man and punish him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will fine him 2¼ pounds of silver and give it to the girl’s father. The husband ruined the reputation of an Israelite virgin. She will continue to be his wife, and he can never divorce her as long as he lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the charge is true, and no evidence that the girl was a virgin can be found,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they must take the girl to the entrance of her father’s house. The men of her city must stone her to death because she has committed such a godless act in Israel: She had sex before marriage, while she was still living in her father’s house. You must get rid of this evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man is caught having sexual intercourse with a married woman, both that man and the woman must die. You must get rid of this evil in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what you must do when a man has sexual intercourse with a virgin who is engaged to another man. If this happens in a city,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: take them to the gate of the city and stone them to death. The girl must die because she was in a city and didn’t scream for help. The man must die because he had sex with another man’s wife. You must get rid of this evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if a man rapes an engaged girl out in the country, then only the man must die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t do anything to the girl. She has not committed a sin for which she deserves to die. This is like the case of someone who attacks and murders another person.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man found the girl out in the country. She may have screamed for help, but no one was there to rescue her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what you must do when a man rapes a virgin who isn’t engaged. When the crime is discovered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the man who had sexual intercourse with her must give the girl’s father 1¼ pounds of silver, and she will become his wife. Since he raped her, he can never divorce her as long as he lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man must never marry his father’s wife because this would disgrace his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man whose testicles are crushed or whose penis is cut off may never join the assembly of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man born from an illicit union may not join the assembly of the Lord. No descendant of his may join the assembly of the Lord for ten generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ammonites or Moabites may not join the assembly of the Lord. Not one descendant of theirs may join the assembly of the Lord for ten generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They cannot join because they didn’t greet you with food and water on your trip from Egypt. They even hired Balaam, son of Beor, from Pethor in Aram Naharaim, to curse you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord your God refused to listen to Balaam. Instead, he turned Balaam’s curse into a blessing for you because the Lord your God loves you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never offer them peace or friendship as long as you live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never consider the Edomites disgusting. They’re your relatives. Never consider the Egyptians disgusting. You once were foreigners living in their country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their grandchildren may join the assembly of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you’re at war and have set up camp to fight your enemies, stay away from anything that will make you unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If one of your men becomes unclean from a nocturnal emission, he must go outside the camp and stay there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Toward evening he must wash, and at sunset he may come back to camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Choose a place outside the camp where you can go to relieve yourself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must carry a pointed stick as part of your equipment. When you go outside to squat, dig a hole with it. When you’re done, cover up your excrement.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God moves around in your camp to protect you and hand your enemies over to you. So your camp must always be holy. This way, the Lord will never see anything offensive among you and turn away from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a slave escapes from his master and comes to you, don’t return him to his master.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let him stay with you and live among your people wherever he chooses, in any of your cities that seems best to him. Never mistreat him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No Israelite man or woman should ever become a temple prostitute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never bring gifts or money earned by prostitution into the house of the Lord your God as an offering you vowed to give. These earnings are disgusting to the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never charge another Israelite any interest on money, food, or anything else that is borrowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may charge a foreigner interest, but not an Israelite. Then the Lord your God will bless you in everything you do once you’ve entered the land and taken possession of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you make a vow to the Lord your God, don’t avoid keeping it. The Lord your God expects you to keep it. You would be guilty of a sin if you didn’t.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you didn’t make a vow, you would not be guilty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make sure you do what you said you would do in your vow. You freely chose to make your vow to the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you go into your neighbor’s vineyard, you may eat as many grapes as you like until you’re full. But never put any in your basket.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you go into your neighbor’s grain field, you may pick grain by hand. But never use a sickle to cut your neighbor’s grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what you must do if a husband writes out a certificate of divorce, gives it to his wife, and makes her leave his house. (He divorced her because he found out something indecent about her and she no longer pleased him.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She might marry another man after she leaves his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If her second husband doesn’t love her and divorces her, or if he dies,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: her first husband is not allowed to marry her again. She has become unclean. This would be disgusting in the Lord’s presence. Don’t pollute with sin the land that the Lord your God is giving you as your property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man who has recently been married will be free from military duty or any other public service. For one year he is free to stay at home and make his new wife happy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never let a family’s handmill for grinding flour—or even part of a handmill—be taken to guarantee a loan. The family wouldn’t be able to prepare food in order to stay alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever kidnaps another Israelite must die. The kidnapper must die, whether he treated the other person like a slave or sold him. You must get rid of this evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Guard against outbreaks of serious skin diseases. Be very careful to do exactly as the Levitical priests instruct you. Make sure you do what I commanded them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember what the Lord your God did to Miriam on your trip from Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you make a loan to your neighbor, don’t go into his house to take a security deposit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wait outside, and the person to whom you’re making the loan will bring the deposit out to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the person is poor, don’t keep the coat you took as a deposit overnight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make sure you bring it back to him at sunset. When he wears his coat to bed that night, he’ll bless you. You will have done the right thing in the presence of the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t withhold pay from hired workers who are poor and needy, whether they are Israelites or foreigners living in one of your cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pay them each day before sunset because they are poor and need their pay. Otherwise, they will complain to the Lord about you, and you will be condemned for your sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Parents must never be put to death for the crimes of their children, and children must never be put to death for the crimes of their parents. Each person must be put to death for his own crime.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never deprive foreigners and orphans of justice. And never take widows’ clothes to guarantee a loan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember that you were slaves in Egypt and the Lord your God freed you from slavery. So I’m commanding you to do this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what you must do when you’re harvesting wheat in your field. If you forget to bring in one of the bundles of wheat, don’t go back to get it. Leave it there for foreigners, orphans, and widows. Then the Lord your God will bless you in everything you do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you harvest olives from your trees, never knock down all of them. Leave some for foreigners, orphans, and widows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you pick the grapes in your vineyard, don’t pick all of them. Leave some for foreigners, orphans, and widows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember that you were slaves in Egypt. So I’m commanding you to do this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what you must do whenever two people have a disagreement that is brought into court. The judges will hear the case and decide who’s right and who’s wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the person who’s in the wrong deserves to be beaten, the judge will order him to lie down. Then the judge will have him beaten with as many lashes as the crime deserves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Forty lashes may be given, but no more. If an Israelite were given more than that, he would be publicly humiliated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never muzzle an ox when it’s threshing  grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When brothers live together and one of them dies without having a son, his widow must not marry outside the family. Her husband’s brother must marry her and sleep with her. He must do his duty as her brother-in-law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the first son she has will carry the dead brother’s name so that his name won’t die out in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the man doesn’t want to marry his brother’s widow, she must go to the leaders of the city at the city gate. She must say, “My brother-in-law refuses to let his brother’s name continue in Israel. He doesn’t want to do his duty as my brother-in-law.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the leaders of the city must summon him and talk to him. If he persists in saying that he doesn’t want to marry her,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his brother’s widow must go up to him in the presence of the leaders. She must take off one of his sandals and spit in his face. She must make this formal statement: “This is what happens to a man who refuses to continue his brother’s family line.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then in Israel his family will be called the Family of the Man Without a Sandal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what you must do when two men are fighting and the wife of one of them comes to rescue her husband from the man who is beating him. If she tries to stop the fight by grabbing the other man’s genitals,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: cut off her hand. Have no pity on her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never carry two sets of weights, a heavier one and a lighter one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never have two kinds of measures in your house, a larger one and a smaller one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Use accurate and honest weights and measures. Then you will live for a long time in the land that the Lord your God is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who uses dishonest weights and measures is disgusting to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember what the Amalekites did to you on your trip from Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They attacked you when you were tired and exhausted and killed all those who were lagging behind. They weren’t afraid of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when the Lord your God gives you peace from all your enemies around you in the land that he is giving you as your own property, don’t forget to erase every memory of the Amalekites from the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Soon you will enter and take possession of the land that the Lord your God is giving you as your property. When you have settled there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: take some of the first produce harvested from the fields in the land that the Lord your God is giving you, and put it in a basket. Then go to the place where the Lord your God will choose for his name to live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go to the priest who is serving at that time, and tell him, “I declare today to the Lord your God that I have come to the land that the Lord is giving us, as he swore to our ancestors.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priest will take the basket from you and set it down in front of the altar of the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will make this formal statement in the presence of the Lord your God: “My ancestors were wandering Arameans. There were only a few of them when they went to Egypt and lived as foreigners. But then they became a great, powerful, and large nation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Egyptians treated us cruelly, oppressed us, and made us do back-breaking work for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We cried out to the Lord God of our ancestors, and he heard us. He saw our misery, suffering, and oppression.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord used his mighty hand and powerful arm to bring us out of Egypt. He used spectacular and awe-inspiring deeds, miraculous signs, and amazing things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought us to this place and gave us this land flowing with milk and honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So now I’ve brought the first produce harvested from the fields you gave me, Lord.”
You will place the basket in the presence of the Lord your God and bow down in front of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you, the Levites, and the foreigners who live among you can enjoy all the good things which the Lord your God has given you and your family.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every third year is the year when you will store a tenth of that year’s crops in your houses. During that year distribute what you have stored to the Levites, foreigners, orphans, and widows in your cities, and they may eat all they want.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you have distributed all that was stored, say to the Lord your God, “Nothing is left of the holy offering stored in my house. I distributed it to the Levites, foreigners, orphans, and widows as you commanded me. I disobeyed none of your commands, and I didn’t forget to do what you commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I didn’t eat any of this holy offering while I was in mourning. I didn’t distribute any of it while I was unclean. I didn’t offer any of it to the dead. I have obeyed the Lord my God. I have done everything you commanded me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look down from your holy place in heaven. Bless your people Israel and the land flowing with milk and honey that you have given us, as you promised with an oath to our ancestors.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Today the Lord your God is commanding you to obey these laws and rules. You must faithfully obey them with all your heart and with all your soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Today you have declared that the Lord is your God and that you will follow his directions, obey his laws, commands, and rules, and listen to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Today the Lord has declared that you are his people, his own special possession, as he told you. But you must be sure to obey his commands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he will place you high above all the other nations he has made. He will give you praise, fame, and honor, and you will be a people holy to the Lord your God, as he promised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses and the leaders of Israel told the people, “Obey every command I’m giving you today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The day you cross the Jordan River and enter the land that the Lord your God is giving you, set up some large stones and cover them with plaster.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord God of your ancestors is giving you a land flowing with milk and honey, as he promised you. After you’re in that land, write all the words of these teachings on the stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After you cross the Jordan River, set up these stones on Mount Ebal, and cover them with plaster, following the command I’m giving you today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Build an altar of stones there dedicated to the Lord your God. Don’t use an iron chisel on the stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must use uncut stones to build the altar of the Lord your God. Sacrifice burnt offerings on it to the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sacrifice fellowship offerings, eat them there, and enjoy yourselves in the presence of the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Write clearly and carefully all the words of these teachings on the stones you set up.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses and the Levitical priests said to all Israel, “Be quiet and listen, Israel. Today you have become the people of the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Obey the Lord your God and follow his commands and laws which I’m giving you today.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That same day Moses gave the people this command:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After you cross the Jordan River, these are the tribes that will stand on Mount Gerizim to bless the people: Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Joseph, and Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the tribes that will stand on Mount Ebal to announce the curses: Reuben, Gad, Asher, Zebulun, Dan, and Naphtali.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Levites will declare to all the people of Israel in a loud voice:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever has a carved or metal statue, anything disgusting to the Lord that was made by a craftsman, and sets it up in secret will be cursed.” Then all the people will say amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever curses his father or mother will himself be cursed.” Then all the people will say amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever moves his neighbor’s boundary marker will be cursed.” Then all the people will say amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever leads blind people in the wrong direction will be cursed.” Then all the people will say amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever deprives foreigners, orphans, or widows of justice will be cursed.” Then all the people will say amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever has sexual intercourse with his father’s wife will be cursed. He has disgraced his father.” Then all the people will say amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever has sexual intercourse with any animal will be cursed.” Then all the people will say amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever has sexual intercourse with his sister, his father’s daughter, or his mother’s daughter will be cursed.” Then all the people will say amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever has sexual intercourse with his mother-in-law will be cursed.” Then all the people will say amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever kills another person secretly will be cursed.” Then all the people will say amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever accepts money to kill an innocent person will be cursed.” Then all the people will say amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever doesn’t obey every word of these teachings will be cursed.” Then all the people will say amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Carefully obey the Lord your God, and faithfully follow all his commands that I’m giving you today. If you do, the Lord your God will place you high above all the other nations in the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are all the blessings that will come to you and stay close to you because you obey the Lord your God:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be blessed in the city and blessed in the country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be blessed. You will have children. Your land will have crops. Your animals will have offspring. Your cattle will have calves, and your flocks will have lambs and kids.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The grain you harvest and the bread you bake will be blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be blessed when you come and blessed when you go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will defeat your enemies when they attack you. They will attack you from one direction but run away from you in seven directions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will bless your barns and everything you do. The Lord your God will bless you in the land that he is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be the Lord’s holy people, as he promised you with an oath. He will do this if you obey the commands of the Lord your God and follow his directions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the people in the world will see that you are the Lord’s people, and they will be afraid of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will give you plenty of blessings: You will have many children. Your animals will have many offspring. Your soil will produce many crops in the land the Lord will give you, as he swore to your ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will open the heavens, his rich storehouse, for you. He will send rain on your land at the right time and bless everything you do. You will be able to make loans to many nations but won’t need to borrow from any.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will make you the head, not the tail. You will always be at the top, never at the bottom, if you faithfully obey the commands of the Lord your God that I am giving you today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do everything I’m commanding you today. Never worship other gods or serve them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Obey the Lord your God, and faithfully follow all his commands and laws that I am giving you today. If you don’t, all these curses will come to you and stay close to you:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be cursed in the city and cursed in the country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The grain you harvest and the bread you bake will be cursed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be cursed. You will have few children. Your land will have few crops. Your cattle will be cursed with few calves, and your flocks will have few lambs and kids.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be cursed when you come and cursed when you go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will send you curses, panic, and frustration in everything you do until you’re destroyed and quickly disappear for the evil you will do by abandoning the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will send one plague after another on you until he wipes you out of the land you’re about to enter and take possession of.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will strike you with disease, fever, and inflammation; heat waves, drought, scorching winds, and ruined crops. They will pursue you until you die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sky above will look like bronze, and the ground below will be as hard as iron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will send dust storms and sandstorms on you from the sky until you’re destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will let your enemies defeat you. You will attack them from one direction but run away from them in seven directions. You will become a thing of horror to all the kingdoms in the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your dead bodies will be food for all the birds and wild animals. There will be no one to scare them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will strike you with the same boils that plagued the Egyptians. He will strike you with hemorrhoids, sores, and itching that won’t go away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will strike you with madness, blindness, and panic.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will grope in broad daylight as blind people grope in their blindness. You won’t be successful in anything you do. As long as you live, you will be oppressed and robbed with no one to rescue you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be engaged to a woman, but another man will have sex with her. You will build a house, but you won’t live in it. You will plant a vineyard, but you won’t enjoy the grapes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your ox will be butchered as you watch, but you won’t eat any of its meat. You will watch as your donkey is stolen from you, but you’ll never get it back. Your flock will be given to your enemies, and no one will rescue it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will watch with your own eyes as your sons and daughters are given to another nation. You will strain your eyes looking for them all day long, but there will be nothing you can do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People you never knew will eat what your land and your hard work have produced. As long as you live, you will know nothing but oppression and abuse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The things you see will drive you mad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will afflict your knees and legs with severe boils that can’t be cured. The boils will cover your whole body from the soles of your feet to the top of your head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will lead you and the king you choose to a nation that you and your ancestors never knew. There you will worship gods made of wood and stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will become a thing of horror. All the nations where the Lord will send you will make an example of you and ridicule you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will plant many crops in your fields, but harvest little because locusts will destroy your crops.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will plant vineyards and take care of them, but you won’t drink any wine or gather any grapes, because worms will eat them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will have olive trees everywhere in your country but no olive oil to rub on your skin, because the olives will fall off the trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will have sons and daughters, but you won’t be able to keep them because they will be taken as prisoners of war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Crickets will swarm all over your trees and the crops in your fields.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The standard of living for the foreigners who live among you will rise higher and higher, while your standard of living will sink lower and lower.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will be able to make loans to you, but you won’t be able to make loans to them. They will be the head, and you will be the tail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these curses will come to you. They will pursue you and stay close to you until you’re destroyed, because you didn’t obey the Lord your God or follow his commands and laws, which I’m giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These curses will be a sign and an amazing thing to warn you and your descendants forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You didn’t serve the Lord your God with a joyful and happy heart when you had so much.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you will serve your enemies, whom the Lord will send against you. You will serve them even though you are already hungry, thirsty, naked, and in need of everything. The Lord will put a heavy burden of hard work on you until he destroys you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will bring against you a nation from far away, from the ends of the earth. The nation will swoop down on you like an eagle. It will be a nation whose language you won’t understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Its people will be fierce-looking. They will show no respect for the old and no pity for the young.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They’ll eat the offspring of your animals and the crops from your fields until you’re destroyed. They’ll leave you no grain, no new wine, no olive oil, no calves from your herds, and no lambs or kids from your flocks. They’ll continue to do this until they’ve completely ruined you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will blockade all your cities until the high, fortified walls in which you trust come down everywhere in your land. They’ll blockade all the cities everywhere in the land that the Lord your God is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of the hardships your enemies will make you suffer during the blockade, you will eat the flesh of your own children, the sons and daughters, whom the Lord your God has given you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even the most tender and sensitive man among you will become stingy toward his brother, the wife he loves, and the children he still has left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will give none of them any of the flesh of his children that he is eating. It will be all that he has left, because of the hardships your enemies will make you suffer during the blockade of all your cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The most tender and sensitive woman among you—so sensitive and tender that she wouldn’t even step on an ant—will become stingy toward the husband she loves or toward her own son or daughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She won’t share with them the afterbirth from her body and the children she gives birth to. She will secretly eat them out of dire necessity, because of the hardships your enemies will make you suffer during the blockade of your cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You might not faithfully obey every word of the teachings that are written in this book. You might not fear this glorious and awe-inspiring name: the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If so, the Lord will strike you and your descendants with unimaginable plagues. They will be terrible and continuing plagues and severe and lingering diseases.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will again bring all the diseases of Egypt that you dreaded, and they will cling to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will also bring you every kind of sickness and plague not written in this Book of Teachings. They will continue until you’re dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At one time you were as numerous as the stars in the sky. But only a few of you will be left, because you didn’t obey the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At one time the Lord was more than glad to make you prosperous and numerous. Now the Lord will be more than glad to destroy you and wipe you out. You will be torn out of the land you’re about to enter and take possession of.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord will scatter you among all the people of the world, from one end of the earth to the other. There you will serve gods made of wood and stone that neither you nor your ancestors ever knew.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Among those nations you will find no peace, no place to call your own. There the Lord will give you an unsettled mind, failing eyesight, and despair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your life will always be hanging by a thread. You will live in terror day and night. You will never feel sure of your life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the morning you’ll say, “If only it were evening!” And in the evening you’ll say, “If only it were morning!” You’ll talk this way because of the things that will terrify you and because of the things you’ll see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will bring you back to Egypt in ships  on a journey that I said you would never take again. There you will try to sell yourselves as slaves to your enemies, but no one will buy you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the terms of the promise  that the Lord commanded Moses to give to the Israelites in Moab. This was in addition to the promise the Lord gave them at Mount Horeb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Moses summoned all the people of Israel and said to them:
You’ve seen with your own eyes everything that the Lord did in Egypt to Pharaoh, to all his officials, and to his whole country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You also saw those terrible plagues, those miraculous signs, and those spectacular, amazing things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to this day the Lord hasn’t given you a mind that understands, eyes that see, or ears that hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For 40 years I led you through the desert. During that time your clothes and shoes never wore out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You ate no bread and drank no wine or liquor. I did this so that you would know that I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you came to this place, King Sihon of Heshbon and King Og of Bashan came out to fight us, but we defeated them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We took their land and gave it to the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and half of the tribe of Manasseh as their property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Faithfully obey the terms of this promise. Then you will be successful in everything you do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of you are standing here today in the presence of the Lord your God. The heads of your tribes, your leaders, your officers, and all the men of Israel are here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your children, your wives, and the foreigners who cut wood and carry water in your camp are also here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are ready to accept the terms and conditions of the promise that the Lord your God is giving you today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With this promise the Lord will confirm today that you are his people and that he is your God. This is what he told you, and this is what he promised your ancestors Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob with an oath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You aren’t the only people to receive this promise and its conditions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is for those of you who are standing here with us today in the presence of the Lord our God and also for those who are not here today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know how we lived in Egypt and how we passed through other countries on our way here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You saw their disgusting gods and idols made of wood, stone, silver, and gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make sure there is no man, woman, family, or tribe among you today who turns from the Lord our God to worship the gods of those nations. Make sure that no one among you is the source of this kind of bitter poison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Someone may hear the conditions of this promise. He may think that he is so blessed that he can say, “I’ll be safe even if I go my own stubborn way. After all, the Lord would never sweep away well-watered ground along with dry ground.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will never be willing to forgive that person, because the Lord’s burning anger will smolder against him. All the curses described in this book will happen to him. The Lord will erase every memory of that person’s name from the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord will single him out from all the tribes of Israel for disaster based on all the conditions of the promise written in this Book of the Teachings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the next generation of your children and foreigners who come from distant countries will see the plagues that have happened in this land and the diseases the Lord sent here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will see all the soil poisoned with sulfur and salt. Nothing will be planted. Nothing will be growing. There will be no plants in sight. It will be as desolate as Sodom, Gomorrah, Admah, and Zeboiim, cities the Lord destroyed in fierce anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the other nations in the world will ask, “Why has the Lord done this to their land? Why is he so angry?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The answer will be, “Because they abandoned the promise of the Lord God of their ancestors. He made this promise to them when he brought them out of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They worshiped other gods and bowed down to them. These were gods they never heard of, gods the Lord didn’t permit them to have.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord became angry with this land and brought on it all the curses described in this book.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In his fierce anger and fury the Lord uprooted these people from their land and deported them to another country, where they still are today.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some things are hidden. They belong to the Lord our God. But the things that have been revealed in these teachings belong to us and to our children forever. We must obey every word of these teachings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these blessings and curses I have spoken about will happen to you. Take them to heart when you are among all the nations where the Lord your God will scatter you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you and your children return to the Lord your God and obey him with all your heart and with all your soul, doing everything I command you today,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he will restore your fortunes. He will have mercy on you and gather you from all the nations of the world where he will scatter you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even if you are scattered to the most distant country in the world, the Lord your God will gather you and bring you back from there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God will bring you to the land your ancestors owned. You will take possession of it, and the Lord will make you more prosperous and numerous than your ancestors were.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God will circumcise your hearts and the hearts of your descendants. You will love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul, and you will live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord your God will put all these curses on your enemies, those who hate you and persecute you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will again obey the Lord and follow all his commands that I’m giving you today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God will give you many blessings in everything you do: You will have many children. Your animals will have many offspring. Your soil will produce many crops. The Lord will again delight in making you as prosperous as he made your ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will do this if you obey him and follow his commands and laws that are written in this Book of Teachings and return to the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This command I’m giving you today isn’t too hard for you or beyond your reach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It’s not in heaven. You don’t have to ask, “Who will go to heaven to get this command for us so that we can hear it and obey it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This command isn’t on the other side of the sea. You don’t have to ask, “Who will cross the sea to get it for us so that we can hear it and obey it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No, these words are very near you. They’re in your mouth and in your heart so that you will obey them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Today I offer you life and prosperity or death and destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what I’m commanding you today: Love the Lord your God, follow his directions, and obey his commands, laws, and rules. Then you will live, your population will increase, and the Lord your God will bless you in the land that you’re about to enter and take possession of.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But your hearts might turn away, and you might not listen. You might be tempted to bow down to other gods and worship them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you do, I tell you today that you will certainly be destroyed. You will not live for a long time in the land that you’re going to take possession of when you cross the Jordan River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I call on heaven and earth as witnesses today that I have offered you life or death, blessings or curses. Choose life so that you and your descendants will live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Love the Lord your God, obey him, and be loyal to him. This will be your way of life, and it will mean a long life for you  in the land that the Lord swore to give to your ancestors Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses continued to speak to all the Israelites:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I’m 120 years old now, and I’m not able to lead you anymore. Besides, the Lord has told me that I cannot cross the Jordan River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God is the one who will cross the river ahead of you. He will destroy those nations as you arrive, and you will take possession of their land. Joshua will also cross the river ahead of you, as the Lord told you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will do to those nations what he did to King Sihon and King Og of the Amorites and to their lands when he destroyed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will hand them over to you, and you must do to them everything that I commanded you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be strong and courageous. Don’t tremble! Don’t be afraid of them! The Lord your God is the one who is going with you. He won’t abandon you or leave you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses called for Joshua and said to him in the presence of all Israel, “Be strong and courageous. You will go with these people into the land that the Lord will give them, as he swore to their ancestors. You will help them take possession of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord is the one who is going ahead of you. He will be with you. He won’t abandon you or leave you. So don’t be afraid or terrified.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses wrote down these teachings and gave them to the Levitical priests who carried the ark of the Lord’s promise and to all the leaders of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses commanded them, “At the end of every seventh year you must cancel debts. At that time, during the Festival of Booths,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the Israelites will come into the presence of the Lord your God at the place he will choose. Read these teachings so that they can hear them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Assemble the men, women, and children, as well as the foreigners who live in your cities. Have them listen and learn to fear the Lord your God and faithfully obey every word of these teachings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their children, who don’t know these teachings, must hear them and learn to fear the Lord your God as long as you live in the land that you are going to take possession of when you cross the Jordan River.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses, “The time of your death is coming soon. Call for Joshua. Both of you come to the tent of meeting, and I will give him his instructions.” Moses and Joshua came to the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord appeared in a column of smoke at the entrance to the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses, “Soon you are going to lie down in death with your ancestors. When these people enter the land and are living among the foreigners there, they will chase after foreign gods as though they were prostitutes. They will abandon me and reject the promise  I made to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day I will become angry with them. I will abandon them and turn away from them. They will be destroyed, and many terrible disasters will happen to them. On that day they will ask, ‘Haven’t these disasters happened to us because our God isn’t with us?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day I will certainly turn away from them because of all the evil they’ve done in turning to other gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Write down this song, teach it to the Israelites, and have them sing it. This song will be a witness for me against the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will bring them into the land that I swore to give to their ancestors, a land flowing with milk and honey. When they have eaten all they want and have become fat, they will turn to other gods and worship them. They will despise me and reject my promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When many terrible disasters happen to them, this song will testify against them, because it will never be forgotten by their descendants. I know what their hearts are set on doing, even now before I bring them into the land that I swore to give them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That day Moses wrote down this song and taught it to the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord gave this command to Joshua, son of Nun: “Be strong and courageous, because you will bring the Israelites into the land that I swore to give them, and I will be with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally, Moses finished writing all the words of these teachings in a book.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gave this command to the Levites who carried the ark of the Lord’s promise:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take this Book of Teachings, and put it next to the ark of the promise of the Lord your God, where it will be a witness against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know how rebellious you are. You are impossible to deal with. While I am alive and still with you, you are rebelling against the Lord. How much more rebellious will you be after I die?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Assemble all the leaders of your tribes and your officers in front of me. As they listen, I will speak these words and call on heaven and earth to testify against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know that after I die you will become thoroughly corrupt and turn from the way I have commanded you to live. In the days to come disasters will happen to you because you will make the Lord furious by doing what he considers evil.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, as the whole congregation of Israel listened, Moses recited all the words of this song:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen, heaven, and I will speak.
Earth, hear the words from my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let my teachings come down like raindrops.
Let my words drip like dew,
like gentle rain on grass,
like showers on green plants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will proclaim the name of the Lord.
Give our God the greatness he deserves!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is a rock.
What he does is perfect.
All his ways are fair.
He is a faithful God, who does no wrong.
He is honorable and reliable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He recognizes that his people are corrupt.
To their shame they are no longer his children.
They are devious and scheming.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is this how you repay the Lord,
you foolish and silly people?
Isn’t he your Father and Owner,
who made you and formed you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember a time long ago.
Think about all the past generations.
Ask your fathers to remind you,
and your leaders to tell you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the Most High gave nations their land,
when he divided the descendants of Adam,
he set up borders for the tribes
corresponding to the number of the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the Lord’s people were his property.
Jacob was his own possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He found his people in a desert land,
in a barren place where animals howl.
He guarded them, took care of them,
and protected them because they were helpless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like an eagle that stirs up its nest,
hovers over its young,
spreads its wings to catch them,
and carries them on its feathers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so the Lord alone led his people.
No foreign god was with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He made them ride on the heights of the earth
and fed them with the produce of the fields.
He gave them honey from rocks
and olive oil from solid rock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They ate cheese from cows
and drank milk from sheep and goats.
He gave them fat from lambs,
rams from the stock of Bashan,
male goats, and the best wheat.
They drank the blood-red wine of grapes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jeshurun  got fat and disrespectful.
(You got fat! You were stuffed! You were gorged!)
They abandoned the God who made them
and treated the rock of their salvation like a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They made him furious because they worshiped foreign gods
and angered him because they worshiped worthless idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They sacrificed to demons that are not God,
to gods they never heard of.
These were new gods, who came from nearby,
gods your ancestors never worshiped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
(You ignored the rock who fathered you
and forgot the God who gave you life.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord saw this and rejected them,
because his own sons and daughters had made him angry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said, “I will turn away from them
and find out what will happen to them.
They are devious people,
children who can’t be trusted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They made him furious because they worshiped foreign gods
and angered him because they worshiped worthless idols.
So I will use those who are not my people to make them jealous
and a nation of godless fools to make them angry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My anger has started a fire
that will burn to the depths of hell.
It will consume the earth and its crops
and set the foundations of the mountains on fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will bring one disaster after another on them.
I will use up all my arrows on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will be starved by famines
and ravaged by pestilence and deadly epidemics.
I will send vicious animals against them
along with poisonous animals that crawl on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Foreign wars will kill off their children,
and even at home there will be horrors.
Young men and young women alike will die
as well as nursing babies and gray-haired men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I said that I would cut them in pieces
and erase everyone’s memory of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I didn’t want their enemies to make me angry.
I didn’t want their opponents to misunderstand and say,
‘We won this victory!
It wasn’t the Lord who did all this!’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My people have lost their good sense.
They are not able to understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If only they were wise enough to understand this
and realize what will happen to them!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
