How could one person chase a thousand
or two people make ten thousand flee?
Their rock used these people to defeat them
and the Lord gave them no help.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their rock isn’t like our rock.
Even our enemies will agree with this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their grapevines come from the vineyards of Sodom
and from the fields of Gomorrah.
Their grapes are poisonous,
and their clusters are bitter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their wine is snake venom,
the deadly poison of cobras.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Isn’t this what I’ve stored
under lock and key in my storehouses?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will take revenge and be satisfied.
In due time their foot will slip,
because their day of disaster is near.
Their doom is coming quickly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will judge his people
and have compassion on his servants
when he sees that their strength is gone
and that no one is left, neither slaves nor free people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he will ask, “Where are their gods?
Where is the rock they took refuge in?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where are the gods who ate the fat from their sacrifices
and drank the wine from their wine offerings?
Let them come to help you!
Let them be your refuge!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
See, I am the only God.
There are no others.
I kill, and I make alive.
I wound, and I heal,
and no one can rescue you from my power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I raise my hand toward heaven and solemnly swear:
As surely as I live forever,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will sharpen my flashing sword
and take justice into my own hands.
Then I will take revenge on my enemies
and pay back those who hate me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My arrows will drip with blood
from those who were killed and taken captive.
My sword will cut off the heads
of the enemy who vowed to fight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Joyfully sing with the Lord’s people, you nations,
because he will take revenge for the death of his servants.
He will get even with his enemies
and make peace for his people’s land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses came with Hoshea, son of Nun, and recited all the words of this song as the people listened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses had finished reciting all these words to Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he said to them, “Pay attention to all these warnings I’ve given you today. Then you will command your children to faithfully obey every word of these teachings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t think these words are idle talk. They are your life! By these words you will be able to live for a long time in the land that you are going to take possession of when you cross the Jordan River.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That same day the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go into the Abarim Mountains, to Mount Nebo in Moab, across from Jericho. Take a look at the land of Canaan that I’m giving the Israelites as their own property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On this mountain where you’re going, you will die and join your ancestors in death, as your brother Aaron died on Mount Hor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is because both of you were unfaithful to me at the oasis of Meribah at Kadesh in the Desert of Zin. You didn’t show the Israelites how holy I am.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may see the land from a distance, but you may not enter the land I’m giving the Israelites.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses, the man of God, blessed the Israelites with this blessing before he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said,
“The Lord came from Sinai.
For his people he rose from Seir like the sun.
He appeared like sunshine from Mount Paran.
He came with tens of thousands of holy ones.
On his right was a raging fire for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You certainly love your people.
All your holy ones are in your hands.
They bow at your feet
to receive your instructions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Moses gave us these teachings.
They belong to the assembly of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord was king of Jeshurun 
when the leaders of the people assembled
together with all the tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“May the tribe of Reuben live and not die out,
though their people are few in number.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what he said about the tribe of Judah:
“Hear the cry of Judah, O Lord,
and bring them to their people.
They must defend themselves.
Help them against their enemies.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
About the tribe of Levi he said,
“Your Thummim and Urim  belong to your faithful people.
You tested your people at Massah.
You quarreled with them at the oasis of Meribah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They said that they didn’t know their father and mother.
They didn’t recognize their own brothers.
They didn’t acknowledge their own children.
But they obeyed your word
and were faithful to the terms of your promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They teach Jacob your rules
and give Israel your teachings.
They burn incense for you to smell
and sacrifice burnt offerings on your altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, bless them with strength
and be pleased with the work they do.
Break the backs of those who attack them and hate them
so that they can never get up again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
About the tribe of Benjamin he said,
“The Lord’s beloved people will live securely with him.
The Lord will shelter them all day long,
since he, too, lives on the mountain slopes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
About the tribes of Joseph he said,
“May the Lord bless their land with water,
the best gift heaven can send,
with dew and deep springs below the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the Lord bless their land with crops,
the best gift the sun can give,
the best produce of each month,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the finest fruits from the oldest mountains,
the best from the ancient hills,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and the most plentiful crops of the earth.
May the Lord bless their land with the favor
of the one who was in the burning bush.
May these blessings come to the tribes of Joseph.
May they crown the people who are like princes in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will be as majestic as a firstborn bull.
Their horns will be like the horns of a wild ox.
They will use them to push away nations
including those at the ends of the earth.
The tens of thousands from the tribe of Ephraim
and the thousands from the tribe of Manasseh will be like this.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
About the tribe of Zebulun he said,
“People of Zebulun, enjoy yourselves when you go to war,
and you people of Issachar, enjoy yourselves when you stay at home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will invite nations to their mountain,
and there they will offer the proper sacrifices.
They will be nourished by the abundance from the seas
and the treasures hidden in the sand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
About the tribe of Gad he said,
“Blessed is the one who gives the people of Gad more land.
They wait there like a lion.
They can tear off an arm or a head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They chose the best land for themselves.
Indeed, a commander’s piece of land was reserved for them.
They were leaders of the people
and did for Israel what the Lord considers fair and honorable.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
About the tribe of Dan he said,
“The people of Dan are a lion cub.
Out of Bashan they pounce on their enemies.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
About the tribe of Naphtali he said,
“The people of Naphtali enjoy the Lord’s favor
and are filled with the Lord’s blessings.
They will take possession of the lake and the land south of it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
About the tribe of Asher he said,
“The people of Asher are the most blessed of the sons of Israel.
May they be the Israelites’ favorite tribe
and wash their feet in olive oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the locks and bolts of your gates be made of iron and copper.
May your strength last as long as you live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“There’s no one like your God, Jeshurun!
He rides through the heavens to help you.
In majesty he rides through the clouds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The eternal God is your shelter,
and his everlasting arms support you.
He will force your enemies out of your way
and tell you to destroy them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So Israel will live securely.
Jacob’s spring will be left alone
in a land of grain and new wine.
Dew will drip from Israel’s skies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are blessed, Israel!
Who is like you,
a nation saved by the Lord?
He is a shield that helps you
and a sword that wins your victories.
Your enemies will come crawling to you,
and you will stomp on their backs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses went up on Mount Nebo from the plains of Moab. He went to the top of Pisgah, across from Jericho. The Lord showed him the whole land. He could see Gilead as far as Dan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all of Naphtali, the territory of Ephraim and Manasseh, all the territory of Judah as far as the Mediterranean Sea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Negev, and the Jordan Plain—the valley of Jericho (the City of Palms)—as far as Zoar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to him, “This is the land I promised with an oath to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. I said I would give it to their descendants. I have let you see it with your own eyes, but you may not go there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the Lord had predicted, the Lord’s servant Moses died in Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was buried in a valley in Moab, near Beth Peor. Even today no one knows where his grave is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses was 120 years old when he died. His eyesight never became poor, and he never lost his physical strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Israelites mourned for Moses in the plains of Moab for 30 days. Then the time of mourning for him was over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua, son of Nun, was filled with the Spirit of wisdom, because Moses had laid his hands on him. The Israelites obeyed him and did what the Lord had commanded through Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There has never been another prophet in Israel like Moses, whom the Lord dealt with face to face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was the one the Lord sent to do all the miraculous signs and amazing things in Egypt to Pharaoh, to all his officials, and to his whole country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses used his mighty hand to do all the spectacular and awe-inspiring deeds that were seen by all the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator
